newsitem.title: TAIWAN: Taiwan stocks end up on plastics, electronics.
newsitem.headline: Taiwan stocks end up on plastics, electronics.

text.p: Taiwan share prices ended higher on Saturday on a mild technical rebound as major plastic and electronic issues posted gains, brokers said.
The benchmark stock index finished 34.32 points or 0.42 percent higher at 8,178.70.
Turnover was an active T$88.08 billion in the shortened two-hour Saturday session.
Brokers said investors concentrated on trading industrial issues, including plastics, electrical and electronic shares.
"Saturday's market could be seen as a mild technical rebound with investors buying in well-performed company shares," said manager Chen Han-chung of Yungli Securities.
Plastic issues, led by Formosa Plastics, went up 3.38 percent. The entire electronic sector also advanced 1.31 percent thanks to various electronic blue chips, Chen said.
Formosa Plastics rose rose T$4.5 or 6.67 percent to T$72, and Nan Ya Plastics, a unit of the giant Formosa Plastic group, also soared T$2.5 or 3.52 percent at T$73.5.
United Micro rose T$2 or 2.80 percent to T$73.5, and semiconductor maker Winbond grew T$2.3 or 6.76 percent to T$36.3.
Brokers expected share prices to consolidate in the near term. A trading range of 7,900-8,200 was seen for next week.
